headline: Pumpkin Pie Bread
description: This very moist pumpkin bread, simply seasoned with pumpkin pie spice, really needs no other adornment.
name: Pumpkin Pie Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9x5 inch loaf pans. Sift together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and pumpkin pie spice. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat together sugar, oil, eggs, and pumpkin. Stir in flour mixture alternately with water. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans.

Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. For best flavor, store wrapped in plastic wrap at room temperature for a full day before serving.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make only filled loaf pans 1/3 full turned out perfect. I will definetly make again.
The recipe was very bland

This is my absolute favorite pumpkin bread. I also use this recipe to make sweet potato bread - just add sweet potatoes instead of pumpkin! Sometimes we throw in some mini chocolate chips too. The only thing I change is, I add 1/2 cup of orange juice or any juice instead of water. Everyone in my family loves it.

Mine was still uncooked in the middle when the outer parts were done. I lowered the temp for a few minutes to let it finish cooking. The middle came out nice and moist, but the ends were a little hard and almost burnt. I noticed some reviews mentioned lack of taste, but I added a tsp of vanilla extract and the taste was pretty good, but maybe I should have done 2 tsp. I made it for Thanksgiving and everyone loved it, but I think it still has room for improvement.

Very good! I followed some of the suggestions here: reduced the sugar (2/3 white and 2/3 brown), reduced the oil to 1/2 cup, and I used apple juice instead of water for more flavor. I also added a tsp of orange zest and 1/4 c orange juice. The recipe made 24 muffins and 2 mini loaves, baked at 350 for about 20 mins. Very flavorful, moist, and firm. The apple and orange juice brought out the flavor and provided a nice balance to the pumpkin.

I made according to the recipe. It was moist and baked nicely per recipe. It didn't have enough pumpkin flavor my husband and me though. I like Veggieballs recommendation on applesauce substitution for oil.

This is the best pumpkin bread in the world. If you make it the day before and wrap it in tinfoil for the evening the next day it's even better. People who've tried this tell me it's better than the bakery.
Absolutely great! My mom made it this way and I had lost her recipe this is one of the only ones that actually use pumpkin pie spice as she did!

I made the recipe just as it states in the original recipe. I did not have two bread pans so I used one bread pan and one 8 x 8 cake pan they both baked the same length of time they both baked for 60 minutes and came out perfectly. As you can see by my photo I couldn’t wait till the next day to taste it I’ll always taste things almost immediately from the oven
Fabulous!! It was super moist and raised beautifully. Definitely a family favorite!
Added additional teaspoon of pie spice and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon

This was AMAZING!! My husband who is not easily impressed said that it was really good. I had to adjust the amount of ingredients to 12 servings using the servings adjusted because I didn’t have much flour, and it made one perfect sized loaf. I did substitute the water with orange juice after seeing another recipe. The orange juice did not flavor it but according to the other recipe, makes the loaf moist. This was so soft, moist and delicious! I’m not a big fan of pumpkin pie but I love Starbucks pumpkin loaf, and this puts it to shame! Fast and easy to mix up too! Wish I had enough flour to make 2 loaves because this one is almost gone! Just may make it again today.
I halved this recipe and made one loaf. It came out fantastic. Will make again!
Best ever Pumpkin Pie Bread !!! I added 2 cups of chopped walnuts. A little crunch to the outside, very very moist inside. I highly recommend this recipe.

This bakes up really nice and is a beautiful moist loaf of bread. It does taste a lot like pumpkin pie, but I thought it was very bland. I made this exactly as the recipe says. Doubtful I'll make again as there are other amazing pumpkin bread recipes, but I would definitely recommend adding some more spices to this bread.
I will make it again loved it
My family loves this pumpkin bread. It is so easy to make. I usually add chocolate chips to one of the loaves.
I am a moderate, so half apple sauce, half oil. And added the chopped pecans. Freezes well.

I made this recipe to take to a party. I baked it for the time specified in the recipe. Stuck a knife in the center to check it was done and it was still batter in center. It smelled like it was burning. So I turned the oven down to 280 degrees. I let it bake for an additional 15 minutes, checking it every 5 minutes. Finally pulled it out of the oven and the centers of each loaf sunk. Then where I went to turn them out of the pans they both stuck.
This is super moist and so good!

So Good!! Perfect texture and flavor. After reading reviews, and knowing what my family likes, I replaced 1 C flour with 1 C whole wheat flour, doubled the pumpkin pie spice, reduced sugar to 2.5 C, and replaced the 1 C oil with 1 C of additional pumpkin puree. This made 24 muffins, baked for 25 minutes. 
(I use a heaping 1/3 C of batter per muffin.) This is a keeper!

I've made this multiple times now, and omg! Everyone in the family absolutely loves it!!!

The best part:

This recipe can also be used for pumpkin pie cake! Did a 2 layer round cake with cream cheese icing for our son's birthday.... it's to die for!!!

My very picky granddaughter made this bread. I coached the process so I stressed out that exact measurements are important when cooking. This pumpkin bread has now replaced my 25yr old favorite recipe, it was that good! Do need to reduce temp to 325 after 50 mins to avoid dark browning edges. Thanks
Pretty good! I know it’s not the original but I subbed apple sauce for oil and cut sugar in half to make healthier and whole family still gobbled it up
Everyone loves it!
This was amazing! Came out perfectly after one hour. Will totally make this over and over again!

I'll give three stars as it's a good base recipe but I changed it. 

2 tablespoons *freshly ground pumpkin spice mixture that I made*

1 1/2 white sugar
1 1/2 brown sugar

I kept everything else the same

I lost a pumpkin recipe that I used for years, so I tried this one. Even with the addition of more cinnamon (1 Tablespoon) and 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg, 1/2 cup molasses, plus 1/2 cup of walnuts it still lacked moisture and enough flavor.

Also, it had to be tented within 30 minutes with aluminum foil, rotated half-way through (both pans), and it still was done in 60 minutes, so I'm glad to have kept an eye on it and pulled it 10 minutes before the allotted time.

I will try again by adding 1 teaspoon more salt, plain yogurt (1/2 cup), and 1/2 cup raisins soaked in boiling water and allowed to cool.

With the changes I'll make above, the outcome should be much closer to my original recipe which was dense, moist, had the right balance of flavors and spices--and didn't need anything on top.

I do appreciate having something to go by to prompt my memory so thanks for sharing this recipe.
I used mashed banana to replace the eggs and half brown sugar for the sugar. It baked up beautifully! The bread was moist and delicious! I will definitely make this again.

This recipe turned out perfect the first time I tried it. VERY moist and melt in your mouth delicious! I did cut back on the sugar by 1/2 cup. I do wish I would have remembered to use applesauce instead of sugar. I will next time :) By far one of the best recipes I've tried. I had so many great compliments on it, I'll definitely make this again & again.
very easy, very moist- my family loved it!
followed the recipe exactly...was a huge hit...was the first time i made this..easy and i already had the ingredients...which was a definite plus...
All the tips were very helpful. Much thanks to everyone who made suggestions to make this recipe even better.
Ecellent! Very moist!!
I

I added a honey glaze and cooked it a little less. Next time I'll probably do some dark chocolate chips because the recipe is pretty sweet and i feel like the dark chocolate would do a good job offsetting that and add some texture, but overall it was very good. moist, sweet, and makes plenty to feed me and my three hungry roommates.

My family and friends love this bread! I did make changes after I had made it the first time. I cut peeled and steamed 3 granny smith apples and used that rather than the oil. I used 1/2 whole wheat & 1/2 white flour, doubled the spices and added both broken walnuts and crasins (to your liking. We love them so I added a half cup or more of each). I suppose you could call this a new recipe with the changes I have made. I also baked it in a round ring pan, which worked well.

I made the recipe as written except for the pumpkin pie spice. Instead of 3 tsp of pumpkin pie spice, I added a total of 5 tsps. In one loaf of the bread I added a bag of milk chocolate chips. The other loaf I didn't add anything extra. The loaf without the chips took approximately 10 minutes longer than originally called for but the loaf I put the chocolate chips in took about 20 minutes longer. I also put aluminum foil over the 2 loaves about 40 minutes into the cooking process so they didn't get too brown on top. I will make this recipe again.
about the best pumpkin bread I've ever made and it makes great french toast too

Super easy recipe! It was a great one to try with the kiddo. I added alspice, ground ginger, ground cloves and cinnamon to the mix the second time around to make it more flavorful. Definitely one of my favorite bread recipes.

First time I made it, I baked it in loaf pans. It was perfect on the sides but dough in the middle. So I used my extra large muffin pans and made muffins. They were so perfect! So I make these muffins all the time.
I used 30 oz pureed pumpkin, 1 cup of brown sugar, 1 cup of white sugar, and 6 tablespoons of pumpkin pie spice. Next time I will add 1/2 cup of applesauce and reduce oil to 1/2 cup.
I used whole grain flour with seeds,flax seed oil and brown sugar for a healthier version which turned out to be pretty great.

I used applesauce instead of oil and added a cup of chopped walnuts and a cup of dried cranberries, also did half white sugar and half light brown. It is definitely a keeper! Extremely good, moist and delicious!
Made it for coffee hour at church. Delicious! Iwill definitely make again.

This was a great and easy recipe to make! I made 3 medium loaves and they cooked for about 65 minutes. I set the timer for 45 minutes and then added 10 minutes at a time until the toothpick came out clean. It's a little sweet but very spongy and far better than anything you get from a box and just as easy! I'd like a little more pumpkin flavor which is why I am giving it 4 stars and not 5.

I love this recipe! I have made it at least four to five times a year since I found it on here. Over the years I have altered the recipe due to ingredients available at the time. I noticed that when I changed the 3 cups of sugar, to brown sugar or half white half brown. My family likes the taste better! To make the bread extra moist I add one tablespoon of molasses. Occasionally I do add nuts.
Great fall snack!
A really excellent recipe! This recipe will be kept in my collection. I added chopped walnuts to batter before baking.
Excellent texture and flavor. This is a keeper and I will definitely make this again and again.

Love everything about this - I also add chocolate chips, depending on who's eating/their chocolate preferences, and either sprinkle them on top, or mix up to 1 1/2 cups into the bread. Always get loads of compliments!

This was a simplistic recipe that turned out wonderfully. As other reviewers recommended I added a tad more pumpkin pie spice, nutmeg and cinnamon, I also added raisins. My grand kids helped with the recipe, and as they love muffins we made one large pumpkin loaf and a dozen huge muffins, all out of the one mix. Excellent recipe we have already made plans to make more next week.
Delicious!!! I put chopped pecans on top. This one's a keeper. I thought there might have been too much spice in it for my taste but I made it as stated and it was perfect!

I made this bread yesterday and waited till today to try it like the recipe says. It is very moist and delicious. I added walnuts to mine. If you are looking for a good recipe for pumpkin bread this is the one to try.

We've doubled up on the spices. My 16 yr old son and I have made this recipe many times. Even if you buy "pure" pumpkin in the store it's not necessarily pumpkin. We stock up on the smaller higher sugar content pumpkins in the fall when they're available, slice in half, seed, and bake on parchment until soft, then scoop out the pumpkin, purée and store in 1 pound increments in Ziploc bags in the freezer

Our guests and my husband loved this bread. I used 1 c sugar plus 1 cup Splenda, added 1/4 c powdered milk ( I'm diabetic) and cut back the oil to 3/4 c and increased the pumpkin pie spice to 4 teaspoons . This is a keeper for us. May try adding raisins or walnuts next time
I just applesauce instead of oil and I only used one and a half cups of sugar instead of three and it tasted great.

Only rated 4 stars because I modified it. I decreased sugar to one cup and substituted 1 cup pureed raisins. I also used apple sauce instead of oil. It came out very tasty and moist, and was a big hit at my Thanksgiving dinner. I'll definitely make it again!
Easy to make, makes the house smell amazing, and tastes delicious!! Thank You!!

Made this 2 weeks ago with the intention of eating one and freezing one. As I type this I have 2 more loaves in the oven because we ate both the last time, they were so good!!

I have cut the sugar down to 2 cups on the ones I am baking now but other than that I have followed the recipe.

Looking forward to having these on hand over the Christmas season.
Daughter made this for the first time - said it didn't have enough pumpkin flavor on the first day. We will update for day 2 tasting.
The cases it good, just a little heavy. I thought perhaps it was my ingredients, so I bought fresh ingredients, and same results. Never raised. It was a great sticky pudding bread:)

I only made one loaf because I had half a can of pumpkin pie mix and half a can of evaporated milk (in place of the water) from a previous pie that I made. I also added a half cup of chopped toasted pecans, some extra ginger powder to taste. It was delicious. So yummy, moist and amazing. We ate half of it immediately... And remembered we had to share with the rest of the family... Lol.. Very yummy and good recipe.
This is my go to recipe for pumpkin bread. I half the oil and use half applesauce, also cut sugar by 1/3. I also use brown sugar and like to add mini chocolate chips and walnuts. It is delicious!

I made this 2 years ago. My family and friends loved it. I Tweaked some things ( just a little bit) but for the most part came out great. Yes the temp for the loafs had to stay in longer, but I also did small muffins for quick breakfast and snack options. I'm back at it again this year again. ( my mother passed away last year so I didn't feel like baking with out her)
I've made this a few times and everyone loves it. I've taken it twice as a potluck share and it gets devoured!

I love this recipe! It is moist and tastes like pumpkin pie. I changed the cup of oil, instead using 1/3 cup applesauce, and 2/3 cup oil. I also dropped a cup of sugar, using only 2 cups, and added about 1/3 cup of chocolate chunks. Overall, a fantastic recipe. I am totally going to send this to my friends! 
(P.S. These make GREAT mini-muffins!)

I've made this recipe several times now and with great results, as written, although I use 2 cups of fresh pumpkin which I had pureed, bagged and frozen after Hallowe'en . This latest time, I decided to add 1/4 cup raisins and 1/4 cup minced orange peel (the peel of one clementine orange was perfect), and I cut back a little bit on the sugar. Delicious !
This recipe is awesome! Even my grandkids love it!
i made this bread for thanksgiving,it was was really good and my family loved it,we used real butter on it and it was awesome
Made this straight by the recipe, liked it so much I made a second batch the next day. Great use of left over Halloween pumpkins.

I made this pumpkin bread just as the recipe indicates. I used two 9 x 5 glass dishes but on one I put pumpkin seeds on the top. It got rave reviews. In fact on friend said it was very very close to Starbucks. :)

This is a great recipe! I replaced half of the oil with apple sauce and it was so very moist! This is a keeper! Oh! I greased the bread pan and then added sugar. It added a nice texture to the outside.
Great recipe...makes a HUGE batch of bread. I use a 9x13 pan and cut in bread size portions. Always moist and delicious.

I couldn't bear the thought of using 3 cups of white sugar so I used 2 tsp liquid Stevia, 1 c honey, and 2 apples (chopped, softened in microwave 3 min, mashed in Vitamix) to sweeten the recipe instead. I'm also gluten-free so I substituted GF flour for the white flour. The bread tastes GREAT and inside is moist and yummy but the outside got burned. If anyone has ideas for preventing this from happening, would love to hear them.

WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL. My next step is to make a Gluten-Free version for my Mother.....
Very nice.
Jb
I had to make a few changes on measurements and it didn't really turn out very pumpkiny but it tasted great
I added 1 teas vanilla and coarsely chopped walnuts. Watch cooking time. Mine was ready in 55 minutes. Very good! My husband even toasted for breakfast (with butter on it).
My family LOVES this bread. I haven't gone back to my old recipe since I found this one. :D

I absolutely love this recipe!! I have been making this same recipe for 3 years now. Instead of canned pumpkin puree i cook my own pumpkins and i also add 1/2 tsp of ground cloves and 1/2 tsp of allspice.
Easy to make. Made it just like it said but i add 1 Banana. And 1 cup of Pecans . Turn out great. ..

I didn't have 2 loaf pans so i made one a loaf and the other i made into small cupcakes, that I only cooked for about 30 minutes and topped with a simple cream cheese frosting. My lady loved the cupcakes. the rest of the recipe was followed as it was listed.
Too sweet. Cut down the sugar by 1/3. Replace the oil with applesauce. Use whole wheat flour for half the flour. Kids liked it.

I made this yesterday and it was so good! I drizzled a cream cheese glaze over the top and it was delicious! So delicious in fact, that I have to make more today because we ate it all haha! I followed the directions exactly (with the exception of the glaze I added). This time I'm going to add some pecans because I feel it needs a little something special, though it is delicious as is.

I made this wonderful pumpkin bread! Didn't have any pumpkin spice, I substituted 2 tsp allspice, and 1 tsp cinnamon. Turned out perfect! Also I only have 1 loaf pan, so I made muffins with the rest. Those only had to bake for 20 minutes.

This was a very easy recipe. I made it for work and only wanted one loaf, so I halved all the ingredients but the pumpkin and left out the oil. It was very moist and tasty and low-fat! It took all of 70 min to bake but it was worth it. I wrapped it up in plastic wrap like it said but not a full day; it was about 14 hours.

Tripled recipe....made some adjustments!
7c white flour + 3 1/2 whole wheat flour
1 c. brown sugar + 1c. white
1 c. Oil + 2 c. Applesauce
3 tbsp. Baking pdr
2 tbsp. Baking soda
*This is amounts for triple batch!
Very bland and dry, would not recommend using the 5x3 pans

Making the recipe as originally directed. it was fine, but I am really trying to cut the extra oil/fat from my diet, so I used the modifications from user Limniade above, and once I tweak the spices to my liking, it will be amazing!
The only change I made, is that I added 2tbsp bourbon into the batter. It's part of how my dad always made pumpkin pie, and I really like the taste vs pumpkin things made without it.

It's definitely better the second day, and even without any sugary topping, it is great!! I'm thinking the next time I might add some nuts or berries, or maybe substitute apple cider for the water. Lots of opportunities to play!
It was so moist and delicious!!!!
This bread is delicious. I thought I over-cooked mine but it still came out moist and full of flavor. Very fast and easy to make. Would definitely recommend!

I made this twice! My rule for trying out new recipes is to make exactly like the recipe is written so I can review the actual recipe and not my changes to a recipe. As written this recipe is a true winner. I did halve the recipe since I could only find one of my loaf pans, but there's only two of us so that's not necessarily a bad thing. The second run I added pecans to the batter and sprinkled the top with raw sugar that retains it's crunchiness after baking. The recipe was still wonderful and a bit more unique. I would suggest that if you are sprinkling with the sugar to make in a muffin tin as it was a little harder to slice and keep the topping in place. My gas oven has convection bake so I cooked at the stated temp but needed to add an additional 10 minutes. This is normal for my oven so not a big deal. The loaf came out nice and chewy on the outside and very moist on the inside.

Just finished putting in oven. I also modified this recipe. I replaced the canola oil for olive oil. So I will see what happens. I love this recipe because it's simple. In the oven in 30 minutes. Awesome!

Absolutely delicious and moist! Made a couple minor changes based off others reviews: used 4 tsp pumpkin pie spice, 20 oz fresh pumpkin puree, 1 c. white sugar, 2 c. light brown sugar and sprinkled cinnamon sugar on the top before putting in oven to give a little extra sweetness to the crust.
I've replaced part of the oil as a top review suggested, but it was too sweet and dense..

I didn't have any pumpkin but I had an enormous butternut squash, so I cooked that mashed it and substituted it for the pumpkin. I added a bit more spice because I like it that way. The kids and their friends loved it. Good thing I made 3 loaves. Yummy
Fabulous! Substituted 1 1/2c Equal for the white sugar and apple pie spice blend for the pumpkin pie spice. This recipe is a keeper.

I am writing this review after having tasted the bread a few hours out of the oven. Per instructions, it is best the next day, so take this with a grain of salt. I did make one change, substituting the 3/4 cup water for 3/4 of pumpkin puree, and I used homemade puree. I thought the bread was OK. It was moist; pretty much all breads of this type are. The flavor was missing something in my opinion. Dunno, it just didn't come close enough to pumpkin pie to warrant the label. I've made a ton of pumpkin bread recipes. This one comes somewhere in the middle.

I was kind of disappointed with how bland this bread was. I was hoping with the comments that I had read that it would be awesome but it wasn't. It was definitely moist. I used part oil and part apple sauce. I was kind of worried about the amount of sugar in the recipe and did not want to substitute for the sugar for fear that it would affect the taste. You want pumpkin pie bread to taste as awesome as pumpkin pie!!
